because sometimes we all need a little more hope
AboutBooksConnectPosts

So long, Farewell!

Jun 22, 2013

Daily Life
It’s been a year of ups and downs,
With happy thoughts, and tears and frowns.
We’ve breakfasted and worked late nights,
Talked to parents and broken up fights.
We’ve walked in the hallway, and run in the lot.
Wiped runny noses covered in…
We’ve made photocopies and fun little games,
We’ve organized classrooms and memorized names.
We’ve taught some math, and some reading, too,
Plus a bit of science. We caught the flu.
We’ve walked to specials then hurried back
To clean, prepare, chitchat, and pack.
We’ve leaned on each other for cheer and support.
We’ve nibbled on chocolate as we held down the fort.
We’ve washed dirty dishes, and stuck on name tags.
We’ve trash picked for pencils, and heard tongues wag.
Some got married, some were born.
We all had days when we felt worn.
We crossed the days off our morning charts
And felt them tugging on our open hearts.
We’ve been Lefty’s Lions for so long
There’s a sense of pride when we think of his song.
Next year’s changes are more than daunting –
The thought of leaving is a tad bit haunting.
Just know – everyone, whether leaving or staying
We’re a family, bound by a love unfraying.
Enjoy the summer, and good luck next year!
Wherever you end up, I’m glad you were here!

Scribbling Hope

  • moileigh
  • moileigh

Sometimes we don’t get to choose. Sometimes God grabs our hands and leads us on a journey. One we may not understand. One we would not have chosen. But one that shapes, changes, and saves our lives. Because He is merciful. Because He loves us.
